media:group.media:title: Midday: August 8 2020
media:group.media:description: The latest news from the 1 NEWS team.

media:group.media:title: I CAN’T BREATHE
media:group.media:description: 29-year old Alo Ngata was tasered, pepper-sprayed and tied up by Police after he randomly attacked an elderly man in central Auckland in 2018. A few hours later he died in a cell with a spit hood over his head. Witnesses to the arrest heard him call out, “Brother, help me, I can’t breathe”. Family believe that the Police misused the spit hood on Alo and failed to properly monitor his condition. A two year SUNDAY investigation into the arrest and death of Alo Ngata.
